page.title: 15BILLINGE QUARRY
page.content: Billinge quarry is near the top of the hill.Stone used to be mined there to build houses both locally and further afield. The stone has also been used as gravel for roads. Pickavance Haulage, the owners, want to extend the quarry,as a result of a public enquiry this was not allowed and the quarry has now shut down. Because of the dangers of deep water, chemical poisoning and the depth of the quarry the Council has decided to infil it. Due to traffic on the Village roads a route up the side of the quarry is being built. Each night after the tiiping has been finished nine inches of soil are placed on top of the rubbish so that it doesn't pollute the village. It is expected to take twenty years t complete the infil The original owner,Edlestone,left a fund which can be used for landscaping
